Issues.Title: Guard with null checks in adorners
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8070 

Main PR <!-- Link to PR if any that fixed this in the main branch. -->
None
## Description
Missing null checks lead to ArgumentNullException when adding transform to collection, in case transform is null.
<!-- Give a brief summary of the issue and how the pull request is fixing it. -->

## Customer Impact
ArgumentNullException in apps using Validation adorners and similar adorners.
<!-- What is the impact to customers of not taking this fix? -->

## Regression
No. The bug can be reproduced in .NET7 as well, with a different repro route.
<!-- Is this fixing a problem that was introduced in the most recent release, ie., fixing a regression? -->

## Testing
Local, WPF Test Suite.
<!-- What kind of testing has been done with the fix. -->

## Risk
Low. 
<!-- Please assess the risk of taking this fix. Provide details backing up your assessment. -->

Issues.Title: Internal error in the .NET Runtime at IP 00007FFD391326A1 (00007FFD38F60000) with exit code c0000005.
Issues.Body:
### Description

**Event Viewer Log**
CoreCLR Version: 6.0.2023.32017
.NET Version: 6.0.20
Description: The process was terminated due to an internal error in the .NET Runtime at IP 00007FFD391326A1 (00007FFD38F60000) with exit code c0000005.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Faulting module name: coreclr.dll, version: 6.0.2023.32017, time stamp: 0x6491fccb
Exception code: 0xc0000005
Fault offset: 0x00000000001d26a1
Faulting process id: 0xd74
Faulting application start time: 0x01d9c6d22dfb03b1
Faulting module path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App\6.0.20\coreclr.dll

### Reproduction Steps

Every time on application startup

### Expected behavior

Should run ok

### Actual behavior

Failed to run application

### Regression?

**The issue occurs on OS:** Windows server 2022 standard evaluation, build 20348
**Running Fine on OS:** Win-10 19045, Win-11 22621
WPF Application

Issues.Title: Port Ignore NotImplementedException from ITaskbarList to Dotnet 6.0.20
Issues.Body:
We are using Dotnet 6.0.15/20 runtime for our WPF application. And saw an issue with taskbarlist throwing not implemented exception. 

Looks like this was fixed as part of the commit https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/commit/c308dfcad75d7b491ea88d39118fb8aee70d6b87

This commit or fix is not available in 6.0.15/20 version but is present in 8.0 preview versions. (https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/v8.0.0-preview.6.23329.2/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationFramework/System/Windows/Window.cs#L640)

This request is to port this commit to earlier version 6.0.20?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Port Ignore NotImplementedException from ITaskbarList to Dotnet 6.0.20" (#8072)

Issues.Title: [8.0.100-preview.7.23376.3] NETworkManager Cannot add null to the collection error when trying to open dialog with MahApps library
Issues.Body:
### Description

Starting from dotnet-sdk-8.0.100-preview.5.23264.1, NETworkManager gets this error when it opens a dialog MahApps
```
Exception Info: System.ArgumentException: Cannot add null to the collection.
   at System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransformCollection.AddWithoutFiringPublicEvents(GeneralTransform value)
   at System.Windows.Media.GeneralTransformCollection.Add(GeneralTransform value)
```



### Reproduction Steps

**Repro steps**:

1) Run the app with .net8 by updating NETworkManager.runtimeconfig.
```
 "frameworks": [
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.NETCore.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-preview.7.23375.6"
      },
      {
        "name": "Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App",
        "version": "8.0.0-preview.7.23376.1"
      }
```
2) launch the app NETworkManager.exe.
3) Click the Continue button if you see it.
4) Click any icon from the left menu.
5) Click "No Profile found, create one ..." like below screenshot.

![screenshot1](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/assets/83067197/d9c8d10a-cf9f-4161-aed2-7995d5237aca)


### Expected behavior

Displays create profile dialog.

### Actual behavior

The app stops working.

Issues.Title: MarkupExtension in Windows.Resources will fail Control with x:Shared="False"
Issues.Body:
### Description

By creating an instance of a subclass of `MarkupExtension` at the beginning of a `ResourceDictionary`, Controls within the same `ResourceDictionary` with `x:Shared="False"` seems not working

### Reproduction Steps

My code is as follows:

```xaml
<Window x:Class="WpfApp1.MainWindow"
        ...
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:WpfApp1">
    <Window.Resources>

        <local:ClassInheritME x:Key="class" />

        <TextBox x:Key="box" x:Shared="False" />
        
    </Window.Resources>
    
    <StackPanel>
        <ContentControl Content="{StaticResource box}" />
        <ContentControl Content="{StaticResource box}" />
        <ContentControl Content="{StaticResource box}" />
    </StackPanel>
</Window>
```

And the class `ClassInheritME` is a plain class inheriting `MarkupExtension`, which looks like:

```C#
using System.Windows.Markup;

namespace WpfApp1
{
    [MarkupExtensionReturnType(typeof(ClassInheritME))]
    internal class ClassInheritME : MarkupExtension
    {
        public override object ProvideValue(IServiceProvider serviceProvider)
        {
            return this;
        }
    }
}
```

### Expected behavior

If everything works fine, there will be three individual `TextBox` in the `StackPanel`.

### Actual behavior

By writing the ClassInheritME at the beginning of `Window.Resources`, the `TextBox` with `x:Shared="False"` seems not working, as there is only be one `TextBox` visible since they are referencing the same one.

However, as long as moving the `ClassInheritME` instance to anywhere but not the beginning of the `Window.Resources` clause, then the problem is solved, and the `x:Shared="False"` works fine by showing all three `TextBox`.

### Regression?

_No response_

### Known Workarounds

_No response_

### Impact

This bug seems to only occur when instantiating a `MarkupExtension` subclass at the very beginning of a `ResourceDictionary`, and then Controls with `x:Shared="False"` fails.

### Configuration

I tried .NET 6.0 and 7.0 on both Windows 10 (22H2) and 11 (22H2)

### Other information

_No response_
